titleStmt.title: Will of Joan Thorne, Widow. 16 May, 1523

abstract.p: The last will and testament of Joan Thorne, widow of Robert Thorne the elder (d. 1519). The will was written on the 10 April 1523 and was proved on 16 May 1523.

div.p:
In the name of god the fader the sonne and holy goost thre persones and one god
and of the blissed virgyn our Lady saint mary and of all the saintes of hevyn I Johane Thorne widow
late the wife of Robert Thorne being sike and feble of body but in goode and parfite mynde suche as
it pleasith god to geve me firmely beleving in the faith of Crist and in all that our moder the Holy
Churche holdith and belevith In the which faith I protest to lyve and dye And for that I fere deth
which is naturall for every lyving Creature willing to dispoase me to the best for the salvacion
of my soule that god will geve me grace doo ordeyn and make this my testament and Last Wille /
after the maner and forme folowing / ffirst I bequeth my soule to almighty god that created it and
redemed it humbly beseching him on it to have mercy and to putt it in his eternall glorye
to the Lawde and praise of his blissed name Also my body I will to be buried in the Crowde of
Saint Nicholas Church under the stone a redy laide by my forsaide husbonde And that at my burying
be saide solempne masse and diriges with all other thinges that a cristen woman ought to have
And that in the said buriall be spent to the sume of viij li sterling Also I will there be gevyn at
the tyme of my said burying in almes to pour people xij li sterling of the which I will the viij li
be in money / and the iiij li in bred so that every pour persone may have a peny in money and half
a peny loof as longe as it lestith / And that at my monethes mynde and Twelvemonthes
mynde be spent asmoch at every tyme Also I will that xij pour women of my neighbours
of this parishe of Saint Nicholas be gevyn xij white garmentes wtwith xij kercheffes of holond
and to every of them iiij d a weke fro the day of my burying untill the monthes mynde be
past for that they shall specially in the said tyme be present in the Churche to pray for my soule
Also I will that incontynently after that I am buried be delivered to every prest of this towne
of Bristoll one peny for that in their masse they may pray for my soule / Also I will that
every day from the tyme of my burying untill the day of my monthes mynde be saide solempn
masse and diriges for my soule / Also all the forsaid fynisshed and doon I will that my dettes be
paide afore all thinge yf any thinge appere that I shuld owe by writing or by good recorde Also I wil
there be gevyn to the Vicar of saint Nicholas Churche for forgotten tithes and offeringes iij s iiij d Also
I will to be gevyn to my moder Church of Worcetor ij s Also I will there be gevyn to the iiij Almes
howses in this towne and to the Relef of the prisoners of Newgate at iiij tymes in the yere / that
is to sey at the iiij yuiver daies to every of them ii s at every tyme for the space of xij monthes /
so that all that shalbe gevyn amount to xl s / Also I will there be gevyn to the abbey of Saint Austeyn
towardes the bilding xl s / Also I will there be gevyn to the iiij orders of ffreres of this towne to every
order x s / Also I bequeth and geve to saint Nicholas Church a sute of vestmentes of blak velwett
to honor god and saint Nicholas with And that I may be praid for every Sonday / And if the said
vestmentes be hired out to any place / then I will to be receyved for the loone of theym x s sterlinges
Of the which I will viij s to be gevyn Immediately to the iiij orders of ffreres of this towne that is to every
order ij s and that restith for Saint Nicholas Church / Also I geve and bequeth to Saint Nicholas Church a paire
of Candelstickes of silver parcell gilt weyng lxxxxvij ounces and more I bequeth unto the said Church A
pawll of Blak Chamlet and velwet Also I bequeth to sir Thomas Tasker my gostely fader vj s viij d / And
to the parishe prest of saint Nicholas Churche iij s iiij d to praye for me Also I geve more to the said Church
of Saint Nicholas a vestment of blak Chamlet wtwith a Corporas and a caas with suche as is belonging for the
said vestment and to be occupied at saint John Evangelites awter in the said Church. Also I bequeth to saint
Mighelles awter in the Crowde a paire of vestmentes of grene and Red Satten of bruges and a Chaleis wtwith
a paire of Cruettes of silver weyng xxiij ounces Also I will to be gevyn to the Trinitie House at Lafordes
yate which was wont to be a brewhouse and a bakhouse for pour people x li sterling with this
condicion that he that shall take it shalbe bounde to occupie the said house to the use that the saide
house was ordeyned and to maynteyn it for the space of x yeres which x li I was put in trust by
a frende of myn decessed and it must be demaunded of Sir John Goodrich prest William Wosley and John
Wyott Executours unto my husbonde Robert Thorne for that they receyved it of Hugh Elyot wtwith a more sume
of the which x li I discharge my self and charge theym as they shall answere afore god to se this dede
complissed / Also I will there be gevyn to the Charterhous of Wittam a maser weying wtwith the tree vij
ounces and half / And more to the said house I bequeth xl s sterlinges towardes the bilding of the howse on
the brigge that maister Rodeney gave the grounde Also I will be gevyn unto my Lady Abbesse of Lacok
a Rynge with a stone called a granatyn weying xiiij s iiij d And to every of hir susters in the said place
ij s in money to pray for my soule / Also I bequeth to my doughter Elynor Nonne of the said place vj li xiij s
iiij d in redy money more a Rynge wtwith a perle waying xij s vjd A fetherbed a bolster a paire of blankettes
a paire of shetes a Coverlet of Aras which is wrought wtwith flowers and lyned wtwith Canvas / Also I geve
and bequeth to my sonne in Lawe William Wosseley a Rynge wtwith a saffier weying xxxvj s viij d and thre
yardes of blak velwet for a doblet And to my doughter his wife I bequeth a gowne which is a Scarlett
and my best gurdell of goldsmythes werk desyring them to pray for my soule Also I bequethe to my
doughter Alice the wife of Thomas Jakman a gurdell of white silver goldsmythes werk / A gowne
of violett in grayne lyned with Sarsenet and purfild with velvet a wosted kirtell / a standing Cup
gilt wtwith a Cover weying xxxiiij ounces a dymysent raysed work sett with perle / a Crymsyn gown
furred wtwith Calaber a violet gowne furred wtwith gray / a blak gowne purfild wtwith velwet a kirtell of
Skarlet an other of Crymsyn and two Rynges the one of garnatyn and the other a perle weyng both
xiiij s vj d Also I will to be gevyn to my Cosyn Poll Wethipoll a flatt gilt Cupp weying x ounces
and half a quart / And to my Cosyn Anne his wife a gowne Violett in grayn purfild with tawny
velvet and lyned with sarsenet Also I bequeth to my Cosyn Edmond Wethipoll the sonne of my
Cosyn Poll Wethipoll a standing Cupp weying xj unces and iij quart / Also I bequeth to my Cosyn
Agnes Mayne the wife of John A Mayne a violet gowne in grayne furred wtwith Shank and a kirtell
skarlet a girdell the Coorse nedill werk and the harnes white iij ounces and half And to hir doughter
Agnes A Mayne I geve to hir mariage x li sterling of the xx li that hir fader owith me for somoch
delivered hym Also I bequeth to the suster of Agnes A Mayne wife to Christpofer Capppyr xxx s Also
to Johane Wethipoll the wife of Richard Bysse a ?Rounde gowne of mustre develize and x s in money
Also I will there be gevyn to my John Thorne a blak gowne price xxvj s viij d And to Richard
Prynne a blak gowne of xxvj s viij d to John Thornes wife a gowne of violet purfild with
velwet / And to Ricard Prynnes wife a Violet gowne purfild with shankes Also to John Warys
wife a gowne of colour Sangwyne furred with gray / And to Richard Tomelles wife a tawny gown
lyned wtwith Satyn Sypers and purfild with velwet / And to Humfrey Bosgroves wife a blak gown
lyned wtwith satyn Sypers and purfild wtwith velwet Also I will to be gevyn to Johane fflexall my
servant a gowne of mustre develys purfild wtwith shankes and lyned with Cloth and a Kirtell Crymsyn
Also I bequeth to Humfrey Coston my servaunt xx s in money and a blak gowne / And to Thomas Tyson
the younger my servaunt xx s in money / Also to my two servantes Elizabeth and Margaret to every of
theym xv s and a blak gowne the money to be paide to my said servantes at the yeres mynde / Also
I bequeth to the house of the Gauntes xx s sterling for that they may pray for my soule / Also I
will be gevyn to the Auker at the Gray ffreres iiij yardes of brode Cloth to make him a garment
Also I ordeyn and make for myn executours my sonnes Robert Thorne and Nicholas Thorne / And
theym I require and desire to se this my testament fulfilled / And in theym I put my hool trust
and confidence in charging theym and discharging my self / And for my ij Executors labor
I will they have every of theym xx s sterlinges and more a basyn and an Ewer of silver /
parcell gilt to every of theym And that my forsaid will fulfilled my saide sonnes Robert Thorne and Nicholas
Thorne I wille they receyve into their power all the rest of my goodes as my heires And that it be equally
devided bitwene theym / And for that I cannot write I have herto putt my Seall and have desired the
persones that here under have writen their names for Recordes / Also I will that saint Nicholas Church
have a prest to synge for my soule for the space of iiij yeres / And for his wagis to have every yere
vj li xiij s iiij d And witnesse of trouth I have sealed this wtwith my husbond seall by myn owne hande
yoven the xth day of Aprill in Bristowe And in the yere of our Lord god M D xxiij after the Count of
Inglande And in the xiiijth yere of the Reigne of King Henry the viijth

Probatum fuit testamentum suprascriptum defuncte Coram prefatis Commissarijs in ecclesia Cathedrali
domini Pauli Londoniensi xvj die mensis Maij Anno Domini Millesimo quingentesimo xxiij Iuramento Nicholi Thorne unius
Executoris in huiusmodi testamento nominati Ac approbatum et insinuatum Et comissa fuit administratio auctoritate prefatorum Reverendorum
patrum omnium &et singulorum bonorum iurum &et creditorum dicte defuncte prefato executori De bene &et fideliter administrando
Ac de pleno et fideli Inventario citra festum nativitatis sancti Johannis Baptiste proximum futurum exhibendo Necnon de plano &et vero compto
reddendo Ad sancta dei Evangelia Iuratii / Resrvata potestate etc alteri executori cum venerit etc.

The testament of the above written deceased was proved before the aforesaid commisaries in the Cathedral Church of Saint Paul, London, the sixteenth day of May 1523 AD, by the oath of Nicholas Thorne, an executor named in this testament. And was approved and registered. And the administration of all and singular goods, rights and credits of the said deceased was granted, by the authority of the aforesaid reverend fathers, to the aforesaid executor to administer faithfully and to exhibit a full and faithful inventory before the feast of the Nativity of Saint John the Baptist next coming, and also to render a true and plain account, having been sworn on the Holy Gospels. Reserving power etc. Other executor when he should come.
